inn1.comm: good length delivery on off stump. Defended
pushed into the covers
banged in short, slightly down the leg-side, pulled around the corner to deep square leg
outside off, climbing off the seam, cracking delivery
on the pads, whipped fine to pick off another single
good splice-rattling finale to the over. Tidy enough opening foray
outside off, zipping away, a loose poke from Hafeez
cracking double-whammy, a big nipbacker, cracks into the thigh
and that one goes straight on. Hafeez shoulders arms a touch uncertainly, as well he might
on the toes, zipping into the leg-side
good delivery again, Akmal is half-drawn into the stroke as the ball bounces past his edge
another big inducker, and Akmal is thwacked in the bread-basket. Quite a feisty over
too short, and that's latched onto quickly. Into position early, using the extra bounce in this surface and helped over midwicekt
width outside off, left alone
lovely bowling, anging up the slope then nipping away down it again. Well beaten
more good movement off the surface, and that zips past the edge as well
dabbed back to the bowler off the back foot, Bresnan fields well in one hand, and has a shy at the stumps for good measure
short, and pulled through square leg to keep the strike
outside off stump, zipping away
good delivery again, a cutter this time, and it rolls past the edge at an appreciably lower velocity (ignore the speedgun - it variably talks nonsense)
jamming back into the pads, worked into space
outside off stump, fizzing away and draws a loose stroke
squared up by that one, good length on middle and shaping to off. A thick edge flies safely through third man
that is a total jaffa! Perfect line and length, nibbling back off the pitch and bursting through inside edge, top of pad-flap, and top of middle as well!
whoops. Bresnan feeds Akmal's pads again, and pays the price
better line, outside off, climbing through to the keeper
short, and swished through midwicket. Bresnan's length is veering towards the short
fuller this time, and that's lucky for Akmal. A leading edge loops over Bresnan's head and lands safe at short cover
on the pads again, but Akmal misses out this time. And he's annoyed with himself
angling towards leg stump again, but a firm clip ends up hitting short midwicket. Bresnan got away with that a touch
good accurate stuff from Anderson. He's dropping it in the right areas, ball after ball these days
fuller and driven, but straight at extra cover
squared up by one that nibbles away late, and bounces. Defended cautiously
wider, and wafted down to third man
genuine edge, but it doesn't carry, and Swann at second slip can't deal with an awkward bounce
outside off, through to the keeper. Another fine over from Anderson
outside off, a bit of late swing, and that's a good leave as the ball bends past the stumps
poor bowling from Bresnan, he's mostly got away with his leg-side offerings, but he keeps offering them up nonetheless. And that time it's a freebie
better, outside off, defended
that's more like it from Bresnan. He's coming from wide on the crease, so pitching outside off is the spot
lovely ball. Climbs off the deck and slithers past a defensive jab.
good double-whammy. Another fine delivery on off stump, a hint of movement to burst past the edge
worked down to third man
speared into the pads, squeezed out to short midwicket
good bowling again, outside off and beating the edge. There's just a lick of movement in the offing on this pitch
wider of the stumps, no stroke offered
edged, but safe, through the vacant third slip. Off the back foot, and he just fenced at that
an appeal! Probably the first of the day, which is peculiar given that England's seamers have been in some sort of control. Too high, I reckon. Indeed it is
beats the edge. That's the spot
a flowing drive, but not quite timed. Snaffled as point scampers round to intercept

a massive blow, and that's been coming from Akmal. Bresnan's angle from off to leg has been inviting a mow over midwicket, but that was expertly played, as Akmal came down the track and outside off to loft it into the stands
outside the tramlines
pushed into the covers
back and across, and defended into the covers
better delivery, attacking middle from wide of the crease. Punched to short midwicket
poor delivery,  but expertly dispatched! Way down the leg-side, and lofted off the toes over backward square-leg!
much better, outside off and bending back in. Left alone
cramped for room by a nipbacker. Squirted into the leg-side
swished hard off the toes, and straight to midwicket, where Big Game Belly - and I mean that with  no irony anymore, because his innings here the other day for Warwickshire was sublime - intercepts
outside off, and through to the keeper
finds the gap well, in front of square on the leg-side. An expensive over from Broad
full on off stump, and tapped firmly to cover
Anderson pulls the length back a touch on off stump, this time Hafeez stands tall and punches into the off side
full but slipping down past leg stump as Hafeez is struck on the pad. They steal a leg bye as the ball trickles towards square leg
good length from Anderson, but perhaps just slightly too wide of off stump as he's chopped down to third man for an easy single
Hafeez takes a couple of steps down the wicket but Anderson spots him early and bangs it in short on off stump. Hafeez hops up on his toes to get on top of the bounce

driven on the up through cover! That is quite a shot, there was nothing wrong with the ball at all but Hafeez just pressed slightly forward, keeping his balance, and pushed his hands firmly through the line. Wouldn't have been out of place in a Test match, that shot
Akmal picks up four now! This wasn't quite in the same league as the last shot, but Akmal opened the face of the bat nicely to drive on the up and beat Collingwood at backward point
full and fast on leg stump, if Broad was going for the yorker he's just missed his mark and Akmal is able to whip him out to deep square for one
that's closer to the yorker! But well dug out by Hafeez. That ball may also have just wobbled in through the air slightly
slower ball from Broad, full on off stump. Hafeez tucks to midwicket, picking out the fielder
back of a length on off stump, pushed into the covers off the back foot
bang on target from Broad, that would've clipped the top of off stump if Hafeez hadn't kept it out with a vertical defensive bat
Anderson slips onto leg stump, and is duly glanced down to fine leg for one

that was very close! Huge appeal for lbw from Anderson, Kettleborough has a very long look and eventually says no. Good decision, that looked plumb on first viewing but replays show it rising over leg stump. Hafeez survives
full on off stump, driven carefully into the covers. Though he looks to be in decent touch, Hafeez hasn't rotated the strike all that well today
slapped up and over cover! Stand and deliver from Hafeez as he thrashes this over extra cover. Not a wild shot though, controlled aggression
good batting, he follows that up with a single into the leg side
Anderson goes full on off stump, Akmal is only half forward as he tries to drive down the ground and inside edges the shot onto his pad
good running again. Hafeez tapped it softly towards mid-on, and the ball was rolling slowly enough for there to be time for a quick single. The call came straight away too
full outside off and driven to cover point. No timing in the shot though
short on off stump, Kamran ducks underneath it. He's unhappy as he stands up, Pakistan's 12th man was walking right past the screen behind Broad's arm! He's smiling now though

short, top-edged and a simple catch at square leg! That's not the first time Kamran has fallen in this fashion on this tour - it was similar to both his dismissals in the Cardiff Twenty20s. The ball rose up more sharply than he expected, and though it looked as though he was trying to hook in the air, he's undone by the quick, short ball
bouncer again from Broad! Welcome to the crease Shafiq. To be fair, that was very short indeed and Shafiq didn't have too much trouble getting underneath it
length on off stump, Shafiq presses half forward and defends to point

now, was this just sneaking down the leg side as well? Hafeez is struck on the pad and Anderson launches an emotive appeal. Kettleborough has a good look and turns the appeal down - again a very good decision as replays show
beaten on the outside edge! Anderson moved the last one in to him, but jags this one sharply away and Hafeez is lucky not to get a touch on that
pushed defensively to cover
off the thigh pad and down to Broad at fine leg ... he fires in a throw but it's well wide of the stumps. Good backing up saves overthrows
again a length delivery flicks the thigh pad, but this time goes very fine to fine leg. Though it's rolling up the hill it's got enough on it to beat the field
full and straight, cautiously defended into the leg side
slower through the air from Broad, but picked up early and defended to cover
Hafeez comes forward and taps to cover
bouncer from Broad, ballooning up and over Hafeez as he buckles his knees to get underneath it
short again, not the bouncer but rising up towards the chest in nasty fashion. Hafeez is late on the pull but picks up one as the ball rolls to midwicket
pace and bounce outside off stump! Badly played by Shafiq as well, he just stood at the crease and thrust his bat out to be beaten on the outside edge
that's better from Shafiq, this time he gets the feet moving and nudges the back of a length delivery down to third man
tossed up on off stump from round the wicket to start, watchfully driven to cover
dragged down short, but keeping a touch low and Hafeez can't do much with that, mistiming a pull out to deep square
again just a bit too short from Yardy, and he's punched out to deep cover

dropped by Yardy, but that was a very tough chance! He held this one back and Hafeez was too early in the drive. The ball flew back wide of Yardy, and though he leapt athletically to his left and got a hand to it he couldn't hold on
driven wide of mid-on, and they take a quick single
solid defence from Shafiq to finish the over
a length delivery on middle and leg is nudged straight to midwicket
again Broad slips towards leg stump, this time Hafeez picks up a single through square leg
fast and rising on off stump, Shafiq extends himself to his full height and chops down to gully
back of a length again, this time the ball hits the seam and jags in to the hip. Flicked down to fine leg - long leg is quite wide and so they're back for the second
very similar delivery from Broad, again Shafiq glances him into the leg side but this time it's just the one
width offered outside off, and Hafeez is annoyed with himself for not making more of that. He cuts, but without much intent and straight to point
full just outside off, angled down behind square on the off side
pulled down to short by Yardy, Shafiq is back and across in a flash to slap this out to deep cover
chipped drive over extra cover! But Bresnan does really well on the ropes, charging round to cut that off
tip-and-run into the leg side
sliding on with the arm, and Shafiq inside edges onto his front pad as he comes forward to drive
tickled down to fine leg! Arrowed towards leg stump by Yardy - who comes from a very wide angle round the wicket - and Shafiq just needed to get a touch on that
spin straight away for Swann, and Hafeez is cramped for room as he backs to leg and tries to cut behind point
exploratory appeal from Swann as Hafeez comes forward to the offspinner, which spins in sharply, and is struck on the pad. Inside edge though, and not given
nudged to midwicket for a quick single
Shafiq hangs back and chops to short third man

bowled, and Shafiq didn't have a clue! Classic offspinner's dismissal, drifting full and wide of off to invite the drive, dipping and spinning in sharply to clatter into the stumps. Shafiq has been outclassed here, but he didn't give himself the best chance either - that was a very loose drive. Swann's first over penchant continues!
quicker through the air from Swann, but he's also pulled this down to short and Yousuf is in no trouble whipping to midwicket to get off the mark
good placement from Yousuf, driving and beating extra cover. Still just the one though, as long-off charges round and Yousuf's legs aren't warmed up to push for a hard second just yet
premeditated paddle-sweep from Hafeez, and a slight fumble at fine leg allows them back for the second
pushed down to long-on for an ambled one
Yousuf stays very deep in the crease and punches into the gap at point
backfoot drive from Hafeez, but straight to extra cover
the ball takes the inside edge as Hafeez presses forward in defence, and he picks up a single as it rolls between square leg and midwicket
Hafeez looks for the nudged single intothe leg side, but finds midwicket
better placement this time, as he pushes through square leg. Yousuf almost charges through for what would've been a suicidal single, but is quickly sent back
spinning in sharply from outside off, defended to leg
Yousuf stretches well forward to smother the spin, again this has gripped and turned, taking the inside edge

Swann strikes again! Yousuf is caught behind, great piece of bowling from Swann. The two balls previously both spun in sharply, but this was the arm ball and rushed straight on. Yousuf may well have picked that, and was shaping to dab to third man, but a touch of extra bounce meant the ball kissed the outside edge and nestled safely in Davies' gloves
loose drive from Alam, and he's easily beaten first ball as Swann finds turn and bounce outside off
Yardy finds some turn too as he holds this one back on off stump, but Hafeez watched it carefully and punched into the off side
tapped into the gap at cover, and they charge through for a quick single
Alam goes back and across and forces to point
driven straight to mid-off, not timed. Yardy has stayed round the wicket to Alam
speared in on middle and leg, Alam clips but again can't beat the field at midwicket
and Alam duly takes the one, pushing out to deep cover to stay on strike
tossed up outside off, but again Alam stays back  - which seems to be a feature of his play to the spinners - and cuts to backward point
floated up temptingly by Swann, Hafeez takes the bait, coming down the track, but doesn't quite get to it and drives straight back to Swann
spinning in from off stump, Hafeez hops back and glances behind square on the leg side
tossed up very full on leg stump, Alam doesn't quite look at ease yet, but manages to clip to square leg
again really flighted by Swann, probably the slowest ball he's yet bowled. Hafeez stretches down into a paddles sweep but is deceived in the flight
speared in much quicker, and Hafeez is hurried in defence
cut hard, but straight to point. Good pressure being applied to the new batsman
driven straight back to the bowler
a touch slower through the air, Alam comes forward and defends back down the track
Yardy is changing his pace up every ball here, this one is much quicker and Alam is beaten for pace and struck on the thigh
Alam finally finds a chink in the field, opening the face of the bat to pick up one to short third man. There's Pakistan's 100 too
full on off stump, Hafeez gets right across and nudges to square leg
Hafeez bends into a premeditated sweep and sends the ball down to fine leg, hitting with the spin
tossed up on middle and leg, Alam defends somewhat awkwardly
rushing straight on with the arm from round the wicket! Alam didn't quite pick that up but manages to get some bat on it and keep it out
too short from Swann, but Alam tries to hit this way too hard and ends up mistiming it straight to mid-on
cramped for room again, no run on offer
a hint of width outside off, slapped out to deep cover
short, wide, slapped. That wasn't a good ball, and it was duly punished
fuller and better from Yardy, but more valuable runs as that sneaks off the edge and down towards third man. Intended or otherwise, it did the trick
full face of the bat, eased up to mid-on
slower and fuller, looped into the blockhole, and defended to cover
good work in this over, milking the singles after a strong start. One more to mid-on
outside off from over the wicket, nudged to short square leg, but no single there
slashed out to point and that is Hafeez's fifty. Well played. A solid anchor, but he needs to make it a big one
one more to the total
flicked over the shoulder, not quite Dilshan-style, down to fine leg
full and straight, worked into the covers
jabbed out to midwicket
swept, and swept hard. That's a superb strike, and it blasts through square leg
a slashing inside-edge, misses the stumps. That was a touch lucky
reverse sweep, well executed, not so well directed
more conventional nurdle, picks the gap at midwicket
too short again, but the cover sweeper tidies up
excellent accelerating work from Hafeez. Once again the last ball of the over zooms away for four, this time over the covers. Two steps and an inside-out bosh
dabbed out to cover, off the back foot
good delivery, sharp spin from off stump, that beats the edge
a crazy quick single to short cover, but Hafeez turns it down instantly, and just as well. Good call
quicker delivery, strikes the pad, via a bit of bat
cramped for room as he advances down the track. Swann saw him coming
dabbed to midwicket, slightly lofted but always safe
patted into the covers, off the back foot
lots of movement at the crease, but Bresnan keeps it straightish, and it's dabbed down to third man
quick work on the single, defended down into the crease
open face, steered to Collingwood at backward point
short, not a bad bouncer, but well middled out to the sweeper at midwicket
steered out to gully off the back foot
outside off, dabbed to gully
kept under the cosh by a tight line on off stump
works the single, but this is solid bowling from Swann. Subtle variations in pace and flight, but rarely straying in line or length
looped onto tbe bootlaces, worked to short midwicket

there's the breakthrough, and you have to say that was coming. Round the wicket, Hafeez went to mow over midwicket, a big top-edge to Trott at gully. The end of a good innings, but Pakistan wanted more from their set batsman
sharp spin down the leg-side. Not a lot Swann could do about the fact that that did too much. Except put fewer revs on it, I guess ...
better line and length, to complete a successful over
driven off the back foot, and that's a bit off frustration for Bresnan as a loose shy from the covers gifts an overthrow
tucked up on off stump, on the back foot
deflected down to backward point. Alam likes that area
opens the face to flick a single down to third man
worked out to point with a shuffle of footwork
good delivery to complete the over, full length and cramping any attempt at improvisation
turned off the hip
looped onto the toes, clipped to deep midwicket
turning from off, straightening nicely, tapped to gully
cut firmly, but swept up at backward point
tight and straight
pushed into the off side, another tidy over
outside off, good line, good length, beats the edge
attempted cut, but a bit of extra bounce there. Beats the edge
nibbling down the leg-side, helped off the pads, and a good diving interception at fine leg saves a single
up into the blockhole, driven firmly into the covers
good ball again, climbing outside off stump and hitting the keepers' gloves with a satisfying "woomph"
defended. A fine over, if you excuse those three extras
short, and cut out to the cover sweeper
nowhere to go with that delivery
tapped to cover, looks for the single, but nothing doing there
hangs back in the crease, and a tentative poke to third man
lovely ball, extra air and sharp spin, beats the edge of a loose nurdle
down on the sweep, and that's hit Alam on the helmet! Swann appeals for the sake of it, but that must have been going over. He's not that short!
nudged off the hip to square leg
a massive mow across the line, hits the keeper and deflects to fine leg
drawn forward and pushed to cover
flashed out to cover, tidied up in the deep
in the blockhole, picked up at cover
defended hastily on the back foot, collected at midwicket

first ball after the resumption, and Swann has nailed Alam's middle stump! Beautiful delivery, tossed up, pitching perfectly and spinning just enough. Alam was anchored on the back foot, and in no position to attack that
an appeal! Afridi is sweeping, and outside the line
a measured drive, on the up and over the vacant mid-on, who has dropped back to the boundary, understandably enough
waiting on the back foot, and nurdled to midwicket
flicked round the corner, good running brings two to square leg
Swann's finals take a dent from the last ball of his spell! A massive swipe, straight into the member's enclosure, where one dozing spectator has been clobbered on the head!
nurdled off the pads
good delivery, rising on off stump, could have been a tight call there, but there was a fumble in the covers
whipped past short midwicket
nips off the seam, hits the pads, deflects into the covers
pushed out to cover
cracking improvisation, down on one knee, helped through backward square. Good tempo now from Pakistan
cor, how did that miss? Keeps low on off stump, and just grazes past

it's all happening! Blocked into the crease, the ball rolls back and actually hits the stumps, but doesn't dislodge the bail, the batsmen rush through, and Collingwood tries to kick his way to a run-out, but fails
genuine edge, Davies flies to his right in vain! No slip at this stage
banged in short, and Boom Boom blazes that one in front of square. He's batting like a man with a personal vendetta to settle
slower ball, outside off. Beats the stroke
short, dabbed down to third man, the end of a productive over for Pakistan
that looked like the offcutter to start with, a touch of extra bounce and Afridi is struck on the glove as he looks to tap into the off side

short from Anderson, Afridi seemed to lose sight of this as it rose up at him. He tried a front-foot heave to leg, but the ball strike the splice and  - luckily for him - fell safely in no-man's land at midwicket
back of a length, chopped down to backward point
steered down to third man for one

legcutter from Anderson, and he gets the ball to grip and move away. Afridi was looking to guide this down through the vacant slip cordon and the movement meant it went slightly finer than he was aiming
massive swipe outside off to a slower ball, but a swing-and-a-miss for Afridi
Umar steps right away to leg as Bresnan slips the slower offcutter well wide of off. The ball was within the umpire's guidelines for a wide though, good bowling
Umar is not himself today, slashing flat-footed at a length delivery from Bresnan to be beaten on the outside edge
length again from Bresnan, and sliced down to third man for one
... but he doesn't try anything too expansive just yet, tapping into the off side for a quick single
short outside off, Umar cuts out to deep cover

that's more like it! Another offcutter from Bresnan but it's misdirected down the leg side - a 'hit-me' long-hop. Afridi picked up the line and length early, stepping to off and lifting this right over long leg! Bad delivery from Bresnan, and well-struck from Afridi
Umar tries to launch this over midwicket but a thick inside edge sends the ball flying just past his off stump. Davies does really well behind the stumps to cut the ball off, diving to his left
finally Umar finds the boundary! Anderson offered him some width outside off and he accepted, cutting hard to beat backward point and third man sprinting round the boundary
outside off! Great line from Anderson, nibbling around just outside off and a half-hearted push from Umar is easily beaten
another cutter from Anderson - almost entirely slower cutters from him at this stage - and Umar can't do much with it
Umar tries to run a length delivery down to third man, but chops to backward point
wild swing from Umar, the ball goes absolutely miles up in the air and three fielders converge at midwicket ... Trott was the closest to it but he couldn't quite get to it! Umar survives
cross-seamed bouncer from Broad first up ... but that's too short, ballooning well over Afridi's head and called wide. Broad is not happy but that's a good call from Doctrove, an obvious wide
low full toss this time, slanting towards leg stump and Afridi clips him out to midwicket for one
effort ball from Broad, full and fast outside off. Umar guides him down to third man ... but then runs right across the 'danger area' on the wicket to receive a ticking off from Umpire Doctrove
thumped along the ground out to midwicket, and quick running gets them two. Umar runs well wide of the wicket this time!
nasty, rising delivery outside off! That has burst off a length to beat the edge of Afridi's attempted dab to third man
drilled down to long-on for one
back of a length and fast from Broad, Umar hops and drops the ball down towards point and they steal a quick single
slower ball, full on off stump. Umar, inexplicably, defends back down the track. Surely the time has come to attack?
the ball comes off the thigh pad and goes to short fine leg, Afridi calls him through to get back on strike
yorker from Bresnan, but well dug out by Afridi - drilled back to the bowler, who sticks out a big right hand to cut it off
Afridi falls! One over away from the Powerplay, he tries to launch a slower ball over long-on, but gets underneath it and Strauss runs in from wide long-on to hold a regulation catch
back of a length, tip-and-run as the ball is tapped to midwicket
length delivery, fast and right on off stump. Razzaq has just arrived at the crease and all he can do first ball is keep that out!

Broad strikes with the bouncer once again! Short and fast on off stump, Umar tried to hook but was in no position to play the shot. A steepling top-edge went straight up, and Davies held a good catch. The end of a very scratchy innings from Umar, he never looked at ease
length delivery on middle, Razzaq stays deep in the crease and defends back to the bowler
short and rising into the ribs, Razzaq steps to off and tries a swivel-pull, but the ball comes off the body so leg-byes is the call
short again, but this time Broad errs in line and is called wide as the ball shoots down the leg side
back of a length on middle, and one run is the result after a hurried glance to deep square
full outside off, Umar is late coming forward and mistimes the drive to cover
a crease-bound Umar Gul fends at a rising delivery outside off and is easily beaten on the outside edge
predictably, Anderson starts with the slower ball - a legcutter - and Razzaq taps watchfully to cover
this time the slower ball slips out as a high full toss, clipping Gul's pad on its way through to Davies
length delivery, Gul forces to cover off the back foot to get Razzaq back on strike
yet another slower ball, Razzaq gives himself a bit of room but slaps straight to backward point
slow, dipping full toss is clipped to midwicket
length delivery on off stump - yep, another cutter - and with the fielders all on the edge of the inner ring Gul taps to cover and they take a quick single
short on leg stump, Gul pulls to fine leg
Broad goes full this time, taking Razzaq by surprise and striking him on the pad. There's an appeal from Broad, but that was heading down the leg side and it's quickly turned down
back of a length and fast again, nudged into the covers for one
Gul has missed out here. Broad fired down a leg-stump half-volley, but ball beats bat and strikes pad on the way through to Davies

Gul is struck in the midriff this time, attempting the pull to a shortish delivery. The ball falls close to the stumps, but Razzaq calls him through and Broad's attempted right foot onto the stumps goes wide
short on off stump, Razzaq drops the hands on the shot as the ball rises up past his chest. He smelled that one
pushed with no great intent towards midwicket, where there is a single on offer
finally, aggression from Razzaq! Overpitched outside off by Anderson, Razzaq cleared the left leg and scythed up and over cover
and again! This is an even better shot, length delivery outside off - another slower one - and Razzaq thumped it over cover

huge! Legcutter from Anderson, Razzaq was waiting for it, again clearing the left leg and lifting this crisply over long-on. Such a clean hit, right out of the middle! Razzaq is firing now, very important runs from him
Anderson ups the pace and goes for the yorker, but it doesn't make a difference! Razzaq backs to leg and slaps very hard through cover, there's no stopping that!
a diving cover fielder saves two runs! That was full and very well-hit again by Razzaq, but the man at cover got a hand to it so just two to finish the over
sensible stuff, just nudging to midwicket to get Razzaq back on strike
that has raced to the boundary before anyone had a chance to move, scorching the grass along the way! Low full toss outside off, Razzaq makes room to strike the ball and hammers the drive!
just short of six! That was a flat hit, length delivery on off stump and Razzaq just stood at the crease and carved through the line. There's no stopping him now!
edged to third man, four more! Slashing cut from Razzaq, the ball took a thick edge and looped over short third man

another boundary! Razzaq is taking a heavy toll in these closing overs, he's such a dangerous batsman at this stage of the innings. Bresnan dishes up a full toss on off stump and Razzaq thrashes him in the air and down to long-off
Razzaq finds the rope with the final ball! Bresnan seemed resigned to it as he ran up, the ball was full on off stump and Razzaq creamed it over wide long-off.

inn2.comm: good start from Strauss! Loosener from Shoaib, short and wide outside off and with no great pace. Strauss steps back and forces him powerfully through cover point
fuller and straighter from Shoaib, and Strauss taps to cover
on a length and angling in towards off stump. Strauss hangs back and defends back down the track
beaten outside off! The previous three deliveries angled in to Strauss but this one straightened - with decent pace and bounce - outside off to beat the edge
thrashed through point! You just can't bowl there to Strauss, on a length but well wide of off stump and Strauss picks up four more to point
Shoaib straightens his line, but he's still landing it outside off and Strauss calmly leaves alone
a medium-paced start, full on off stump and Davies taps it back to the bowler
not quite the line for Razzaq, pushing a length delivery down the leg side and that's a wide
leg side again from Razzaq, Davies moves across to off and clips in the air but into space on the leg side. Fine leg is up in the ring so that's four runs!
Razzaq re-adjusts to an off-stump line, and Davies punches to cover
full and straight, Davies drives to mid-on off the back foot
Davies skips to leg to open up the off side, but drills a forcing shot straight to point
full on off stump and Davies nudges defensively to that man at a close midwicket
resounding crack off the bat as Strauss thumps Shoaib through cover! Nothing violent about the stroke, but the ball races over the turf, four more!
tight on off stump from Shoaib, and Strauss drives to mid-off
beaten outside off by an absolute beauty from Shoaib! Pitching middle, moving away off the seam and beating the edge. Strangely, no slip in place though
Shoaib slips onto a leg-stump line and is clipped behind square on the leg side
that'll be another boundary, again Shoaib aims one at the pads and Davies glances him past short fine leg
inside-edged, and a diving Kamran Akmal can't do anything about that! The luck is with Davies as he picks up four more to fine leg
flicked to mid-on, who is a little deep, and Strauss immediately calls for a quick single
nice and straight from Razzaq, but solidly defended by Davies
Davies backs away to leg and tries to thrash Razzaq over cover ... but he may have just given himself too much room there, having to reach for the ball and unable to get a touch on it
defended firmly into the off side
Razzaq hits the seam, moving it away from Davies to beat the outside edge again
Davies walks across to the off side, looking for the pick-up shot on the leg side, but doesn't connect and wears one on the thigh
full and fast from Shoaib - probably his quickest ball of the game - and Strauss drives to mid-off's left
good stop from Afridi as Strauss nails a drive into the covers ... but then he fires a needless shy at the non-striker's end and gives away two overthrows
back of a length on middle and leg, the ball comes off the inner half of the bat and bounces wide of short fine leg
now that is Shoaib's quickest ball of the day! Davies is beaten outside off by a delivery that lands on a length and spits up and away from him
Shoaib can't follow it up though, spearing this one down the leg side to give away a wide
quick again from Shoaib, and Davies takes it off his hip and picks up a run to midwicket
edged, no slip and four runs to third man! That took a thick edge, though, and they would've needed a real athlete at second/third slip to catch that
Razzaq lands one on a length, nibbling it away slightly off the seam, and Davies defends watchfully to cover
slightly fuller this time, but again Davies opts for caution and defends
effort ball from Razzaq, but it slips towards Davies' pads and he clips through square leg for one
short and wide from Razzaq, and Strauss cracks a cut straight to Afridi at point
flat-batted down the ground! Strauss gives himself to room and smears this back at Razzaq, not quite out of the middle but he got enough on the ball to send it rolling away to the straight boundary
punched firmly to mid-off
decent start, moving the ball away off the seam as Davies nudges down to third man
Gul offers Strauss some width, but the shot is stopped by the man at point
back of a length and nippy from Gul! Strauss is taken a little by surprise as he shapes to pull and is struck on the midriff
Strauss is caught off a no-ball! A thick edge flew behind, Kamran going airborne to hold the catch but it's all for nothing, big over-step by Gul!
well, a  bit of an anticlimax there! Strauss backs away and toe-ends a slog to mid-off, no run
full and on the toes, Strauss flicks it out of the middle of the bat but runs are saved by a superb effort at midwicket from Hafeez, who pulls off a clean, tumbling stop
back of a length, tapped back to the bowler
Davies takes two steps to leg but Razzaq follows him with a short ball, and after all that the ball is dropped defensively on the off side
Davies shuffles slightly to off this time, taking a ball off leg stump and glancing just wide of short fine leg, who got a hand to it but couldn't cut it off entirely
short-arm jab to midwicket, and Mohammad Yousuf sets off after the ball, much to the crowd's amusement
chopped down to backward point., Davies is halfway down the track looking for the single before he's sent back by Strauss but he scrambles back to his crease in time
slower ball tucked past short fine-leg, easy picking for Strauss and another four to the total
Strauss remonstrates with himself after fishing at one angled across him to be beaten on the outside edge. He immediately practices the leave
Gul fires down an attempted yorker - at a very decent pace, it must be said - and Davies digs it out to midwicket
handsomely pulled to midwicket! Gul banged one in halfway down and Davies didn't bother keeping the shot down
back of a length again, this time Davies is pushed back in the crease and defends to cover
pushed slightly wide of off, punched nicely by Davies but straight to backward point
on a length on off stump - a testing delivery - and angled defensively to backward point this time
slapped through cover with great authority by Davies! Too short, too wide from Gul, and Davies stood up tall to get on top of the bounce and dismiss the ball from his presence
not all that short, but Strauss picks up the length early - as he does so often - and just thumps it away infront of square on the leg side
Razzaq goes fuller this time, and Strauss drives to mid-off
attempted heave to leg from Strauss, trying to pull it in the air there but perhaps just tried to hit it too hard, inside edging onto the thigh pad
close to the run-out! Strauss tapped to Hafeez at mid-on and set off, the throw came in and if he'd hit the England captain would've been a metre short!
crashed through cover, and Davies finds the boundary once more! The line was much too wide, inviting the shot, and Davies put it away in style
and another! This one wasn't quite as well timed, but Davies backed away to leg to set up the shot and threaded through the covers
short and slightly wide of off, slashed down to third man and they hurry back for the second
rising delivery outside off, and a-play-and-a-miss from Strauss! That did too much to find the edge
slightly fuller, and Strauss punches to cover to pick up one
slightly slower from Gul - although certainly not the regulation slower ball. Davies leans forward and guides to Alam at backward point
back of a length, the ball takes the inside half of the bat and rolls wide of short fine leg for one
slower again from Gul, and the variation is enough to stop Strauss scoring as he taps to backward point
an ambitious pull, under-edged onto the pads
proper contact this time, and a satisfying click of willow to prove it. Pulled out to deep midwicket
nurdled off the hip, smart running puts midwicket under pressure
incredible let-off! Strauss was walking for that lbw - and he doesn't do that very often! But the umpire thought it pitched outside the line. Err ... it didn't
almost did him again! Edged into the off side
flicked off the pads to complete a fortunate over
on the pads, tucked into the gap at midwicket
outside off, nurdled into the point region
worked off the pads again, finds space at square leg
up there for the drive, but drilled straight to Afridi at cover
back and across, flicked to midwicket
quicker ball, dabbed to short midwicket where Ajmal does his own fielding
two steps down the track, swished out to deep midwicket
pushed back onto the defensive. Blocked from deep in the crease
clipped firmly to midwicket
a quicker ball and another excruciatingly tight appeal! This time it hit the ball, but was there pad first? Hafeez is dischuffed
blocked
worked into the covers
ripper from outside leg stump, Strauss attempts to cut off the back foot, and misses
clipped, and cut off. The rate has been slowed now
pulled out to the sweeper in the deep
blocked off a fat inside-edge to square leg. The keeper fields as they scamper a single
looped onto a good length on off stump, clipped to midwicket
quicker ball and there's an appeal, but that's outside leg. Definitely
tucked off the hip, straight to the man at short backward square. Strauss hurtles his single and makes his ground
another clip, this time from Davies, lots of singles on offers, boundaries are at a premium
having said that, there's one! Too short, feeding Strauss's favourite cut, and that's his fifty. His third in four innings this series. Top work from the skipper
tucked into the leg side
quicker ball, Davies drives from the crease, straight to point
clipped uppishly to midwicket
pulled, without conviction
short, and helped out to midwicket to bring up the 100 partnership
open face, worked out to deep point
a hint of turn as Strauss pushes with  bat and pad together
short and slo-oo-ow turn. Chopped into the covers off the back foot
flicked urgently to square leg, and that is drinks
tucked off the pads, no timing
flicked to mid-on
dabbed into the leg-side
sharpish turn, takes a bit of an edge and rolls into the off side
aggression from Davies as he advances down the wicket but can't time his drive
finds the gap on the leg-side
turned into the leg-side as Afridi bowls round the wicket from wide of the crease
a big swish down the leg-side, but can't make proper contact
blocked into the covers
an appeal, as Davies loses his footing, but this is safe. He looked in danger, but he stretched well to regain his ground for the moment the stumps were broken
forward, and defended
flicked to midwicket, Strauss wanted the single, but Davies turned him back, and he had to dive to be safe
well played, opened the face and waited for the ball to turn. Dabbed behind square
driven hard, and that's an easy two as Mohammad Yousuf moseys round to field
slashed, looking to hit straighter than extra cover, which is where the ball ended up. Lands in no-man's land though
defended off the back foot
forward, and defended into the covers
that's the breakthrough! Tossed up outside off stump, Davies chased the drive, but it's the doosra and that sneaks off the inside-edge and back onto the stumps
poked into the covers, and a bit of a mix-up as they debate a single while stood in the middle of the pitch
eased off the hip, out to midwicket
fully forward, smothering defence

another massive appeal, but that's not out, as Trott is struck on the pad deep in his crease, but that was turning down leg. Replays say the leg bail would have been disturbed, but that's a fair call from the umpire
he's off the mark this time
misdirected
pushed down the ground for a single to keep the strike
wide of the crease from round the wicket, worked off the hip
bread and butter for Strauss, who already looks happier with pace on the ball. Eased off the hip again
defended off the back foot. Played down into the crease
a hint of inswing, and defended cautiously from the crease
good delivery, Shoaib senses a bit of unease from Trott, this one nips off the deck and back into the thigh pad
good finish to the over, wider outside off and Trott can't connect with a loose dab
firmly struck, but straight at short cover
sharp spin from round the wicket. Defended cautiously
flapped round the corner, and an instant call to take on the fielder at short fine leg
worked down to long-on, hands the strike straight back
on the pads, pushed to midwicket
tossed up towards the toes, a firm clip to deep midwicket
tight bowling from Shoaib, keeping Trott under wraps for the moment
full and straight
defended with a straight bat, down the ground. Thoughts of a single, but they think better of it
clunked out to point, a touch wider, but fielded safely
tip-and-run ... a quick single straight to mid-off, Razzaq shies but Trott would have been safely home

driven, firmly, but straight to short cover. In that one shot, Strauss looked a whole lot more comfortable against Shoaib than Trott has done since he came in. But that's the way Trott plays. He'll take all the time he needs to get his eye in
a stifled appeal as Trott is hit on the back pad by a skidder. But that was sliding down again
half-forward, the ball snakes off the inside-edge, pad, and on to the stumps!
a massive appeal as Bell is rapped on the pad first ball! Missing leg
forward, tentatively, and defends
uses his feet in an attempt to work the gaps, but can't quite do so
down the ground, and he's off the mark this time
hmm, definitely tailing in through the air there, but wide enough to be left alone by Bell. Is it reversing?
on a length, the ball holds its line this time and Bell taps to cover for one
full on off stump, Strauss defends cautiously to cover

short, wide, cut hard in the air ... and caught at point by Fawad Alam! Shoaib strikes, and Pakistan are right in this again. Strauss had played so well - albeit with a little luck - and his dismissal at this point will put a lot of pressure on England's middle order

past the outside edge! And Shoaib has his hands on his head after this ... Collingwood played for the reverse swing but again this just held its line. To his credit, he just played the line and didn't push out at it
booming inswinging yorker, but dug out by Collingwood with typically low backlift. A testing delivery this early in his innings
Bell takes a couple of steps down the track and taps to wide mid-on
quick through the air from Afridi, and nudged just wide of Shoaib Akhtar at short fine leg
tossed up full and on the toes, and Bell eases down to long-on for one
nurdled to leg by Collingwood, but not without a hint of danger. He was right back on his stumps there and if he hadn't hit that it would've been plumb
and another single to long-on for Bell
turn for Afridi! This was the legspinner, and he got it to grip and spin away from Collingwood's defensive poke
slower ball from Shoaib, but Bell is in great nick at the moment and picks it early, defending under his eyes into the off side
wow, athletic fielding from Fawad Alam! Bell chops down behind point, surely assuming at least one run, but Alam leapt to his left to pull of a great stop
full and fast from Shoaib, zoning in on off stump, and Bell drives back to the bowler
a touch of swing again for Shoaib, curving in to the right-hander. Bell stays deep in the crease and defends to point
full and wide, Bell is slightly late in coming forward to drive, but gets enough of a connection to pick up one out to cover
back of a length outside off, Collingwood thinks about playing it but just yanks his bat inside the line at the last moment. Good leave
Bell skips down the track and whips through midwicket for a couple
flicked to Shoaib's left at short fine leg, but he creaks across quickly enough to negate the run
full outside off, and drilled out to deep cover
speared down the leg side by Afridi, and called wide
there are singles to be had with the field spread, and Collingwood picks one up driving to cover
the sign of a man in good form! Bell waited and waited, letting the ball get right to him and angling the bat at the last moment to angle very late down to third man. Top shot
much fuller on off stump, tapped through cover for a couple
length just outside off to start, definitely a loosener from Gul, and Collingwood defends into the off side

not the greatest shot from Collingwood, standing at the crease and fishing at a delivery outside off. Now Gul's been no-balled here ... but replays suggest his heal was well within the line. A rare error from Kettleborough, and it'll be a Free-hit
full, wide and seaming away. Huge swing from Collingwood, but he connects only with fresh air
jagging back in off the seam this time, and Colly inside-edges onto his pad
great bowling from Gul, he's moving the ball both ways off the pitch. This one jags away to beat the outside edge of Collingwood's bat
huge, emotive appeal from Gul as Collingwood is struck on the pad! Kettleborough says no... and that was going over, good decision
short and wide outside off, that should have been put away but Collingwood just tried to angle it away ... and couldn't beat Alam at backward point
just short of a good length, and eased through cover for one
definite movement in through the air for Razzaq, and Collingwood steps back and punches back to the bowler
Collingwood steps across to off and nurdles through square leg for an ambled single
more inswing for Razzaq, and Bell is cramped for room as he tries to run it down to third man. The ball takes the inside edge and bounces through to Kamran
nicely glanced by Bell down to fine leg ... that could've been a very tight second run but the return throw from Gul wasn't the greatest, being aimed at Kamran's ankles
there's the variation from Razzaq! He'll swing and seam it in consistently and then get the odd one to just hold its line, as this one does, to beat the outside edge
leaden-footed swish from Collingwood, and the ball bursts past the outside edge!

cleaned him up! Collingwood played back when he should have been forward, the ball jagging back in to him from a wider angle on the crease to beat the bat and clatter into the stumps. Collingwood's scratchy knock is brought to an end, but with Morgan's cool head and broad bat to replace him, that might not be the worst news for England...
slippery yorker first ball! It lands outside off and is well dug out by Morgan though...
full, wide, and a slashed square drive is fielded by third man charging round on the rope
back of a length on off stump, Bell gets across and defends right under the eyes into the off side
flicked very fine down to fine leg! Great shot under pressure from Bell as Gul missed his mark with the yorker
full on off stump, Morgan leans forward and defends to cover

thrashed through cover! The ball was full and wide and Morgan stepped forward and across to slap it very hard through cover. Great placement on the shot too, and Shafiq's dive on the boundary is in vain
now, how close was this? Huge appeal as Morgan is struck on the front pad, but Doctrove says no. And he's right, that pitched outside leg
Razzaq keeps it full on off stump, Bell plays into the off side
width outside off, and Bell guides the ball down to third man
full and slanting across the left-hander and going further away off the seam. Morgan leaves well alone
back of a length on or around off stump, Bell plays it nice and late and taps to gully
tucked off the ribcage into the leg side, and an easy single as midwicket runs in from the boundary
this just came back in to Morgan slightly, but he played it defensively under his eyes into the leg side
dropped into space at cover, immediately the ball was hit the call for the single came from Morgan, great running
shaping away from the right-handed Bell and keeping a touch low, the batsman whips his bat inside the line to leave
Gul comes wider on the crease but cuts this away from the right-hander once again, but Bell keeps his bat close to his body and inside the line, well-left
tossed up much slower than usual by Ajmal, Morgan taps back to the bowler
full and outside off, Morgan drives hard out to deep cover
looped up again, but that's slipped out as a full toss and is easily driven out to deep cover for one
nudged down to long-on, plenty of singles to be had with this field
Bell drives just wide of Ajmal, who chases energetically after the ball to make sure they don't get the single
beaten in the flight! That was very close. Bell kept his back foot grounded as Kamran whipped the bails off, but that also gripped and spun in and he could easily have been bowled there
Morgan nails a cut to backward point, but good fielding there keeps them to one
Bell top-edges the sweep ... but the ball lands safely at fine leg
dropped! Afridi it was at extra cover, Morgan drove in the air at above head height to him, he put his hands up and just parried it... that could be a costly miss!
Hafeez keeps it tight, firing it in flat on off stump
swept straight to short fine leg
nudged uppishly! But short of the man at midwicket
flighted outside off, driven watchfully to cover
Morgan steps back and away to open up the off side, picking up one to deep cover
steady defence from Bell
a touch of width outside off, and Bell runs the ball down to short third man for one
driven down to long-on for one, they briefly think about the second but that was never on

gone! Bell falls! Again the catch goes to extra cover but this time Azhar Ali - on as substitute fielder for Yousuf - holds onto a stinging chance. Bell came down the wicket and tried to drive over cover, but didn't get the elevation he wanted. That's given Pakistan a definite lift at a very tense point in the game, and his team surrounds the young man to show their appreciation
chopped hard down to Afridi at backward point ... Afridi is definitely struggling with that hand, he tossed the ball away as soon as it touched him as if it was red-hot and winced with pain
spinning across Morgan from over the wicket, tapped back to the bowler
punched into the covers
Yardy pushes his first ball cautiously into the off side
dangerous shot! Yardy late cuts off the top of off stump to short third man
tapped to cover, and they steal a scrambled single
arrowed down on middle from round the wicket, Yardy taps softly to midwicket and they charge through for one
full outside off, driven hard out to deep cover for one
appeal for a stumping as Yardy leans forward into a defensive push and is beaten by the spin away from the bat. Kettleborough asks the third ump to have a look, but he's well in
swept in the air to square leg, but falling well short of the fielder out there. Not the slog sweep, but uppishly played
hurled down the leg side, the ball clips the pad and a juggling Kamran eventually makes sure there are no byes given away...
dropped down infront of point, and they sprint through for a quick single
landing outside leg, Morgan nudges to midwicket for one
and Yardy hands the strike back with a similar shot, the boundary fielders are 15 yards in so just the one run on offer
yorker on middle, dug out back to the bowler
chopped down into the covers, and a single is immediately called for
nudged to leg once again, the singles are still coming
dabbed into the covers, tip-and-run from Morgan
tapped to cover and they charge through for one
reverse-sweep from Morgan, he's not got a touch on it but still picks up four as the doosra bursts past Akmal's gloves. Shouldn't that be wides too? It was down the leg side
tapped into the off side to follow up, one run the result
and Yardy follows suit, another single to rotate the strike
four more! Big heave into the leg side, and Morgan finds the gap. 12 from the over, vital runs
on the hips, whipped away through square leg for a couple
leg-side again from Akhtar, and this time he'll be wided

played on! Shoaib strikes! He came round the wicket from a very wide angle, hurling it down on a length. Yardy was cramped for room, the inside edge ricocheted off the inside edge and cannoned into the stumps. The old veteran has charged in and picked up a wicket to keep his team in the hunt, and isn't he pleased!
speared in to Bresnan's pads, slipping down leg as it clips the front leg

that could've been run out! Shoaib comes charging in with a crazed look in his eyes, he's really pumped up, the ball comes off the inside edge and goes to short fine leg. Bresnan wandered out of his crease as the throw came in, he would've been metres out!
full and fast again, dug out and Bresnan gets Morgan back on strike
that'll be five wides! Shoaib charged in from round the wicket, banging in a very short  bouncer that ballooned over Morgan, beat a leaping Kamran and was called wide by the umpire
just a single to finish the over, tapped to cover by Morgan
Morgan clears the left leg but Gul goes full and straight, so it's just the one run as the ball rolls to cover

bowled him! Full, fast and swinging in and that's too good for Bresnan. That reversed sharply back in to him, Bresnan tried to whip to leg but was cleaned up. Pakistan may be favourites now, but Morgan's is the wicket they really need.
very full on off stump, close to the yorker and dug out to point by Swann. That seemed to shape away through the air - Gul is bending it both ways! He'll be a real handful for the lower order
Gul misses his mark with the yorker, and Swann picks up two as he clips a leg-stump half-volley out to deep midwicket

dropped by a diving Afridi at midwicket! He got his hand to that, but the ball bobbled out as his elbow hit the ground. That would've been a stupendous catch if he had held on, especially considering the hand injury he's carrying
high full toss on off stump, the ball comes off the splice of Morgan's bat and loops into space infront of long-on. Morgan keeps strike
sharp yorker from round the wicket! Morgan chopped down hard on the ball to keep it out and pick up a single into the off side
dipping, inswinging full toss heading towards middle. Swann doesn't try to do too much with it, just pushing into the off side for one

gone! Morgan tries to slam this down the ground, but slices underneath the ball to send a steepling chance ... to Mohammad Yousuf, of all people! Yousuf has not had the best summer in the field but he's held onto a very tough chance. The two oldest men on the field - on most fields these days - combine to give their team a very strong chance of levelling this series. Pakistan immediately form a huddle, they're pumped up now
hooping inswinging full toss, it slips down the leg side and though Kamran gets a hand to it he can't cut it off completely
Swann finds the boundary! Slashing up and over short third man
how has he kept that out? Perfect inswinging yorker but Swann jams the bat down just in time to keep it out
quick yorker on middle, dug out back to the bowler by Broad
full and swinging in towards leg stump, Swann heaves out into the leg side and sprints back for the second
full and swinging again, drilled down to long-on
swinging back in to the left-hander, but the line is all wrong and the ball swerves down the leg side. That's wide
low, dipping full toss swings back in very late! It was pacy too, but Broad swung hard and sent the ball out to deep midwicket
slower ball, offcutter, and Swann is bowled! He's been bowling such fantastic reverse-swinging yorkers, Swann won't have been expecting that and he's cleaned up! Pakistan are almost there now
Anderson's done well to keep that out! Another very low, dipping full toss and curves late towards the left-hander's toes, but he jams the bat down to keep it out
back of a length, slamming into the thigh and bouncing to gully
tapped infront of point, Broad wants a single but Anderson sends him back
a low full toss flung down at leg stump, Broad digs it out to Afridi at midwicket
slower ball, not picked by Broad but his bat ends up in the right place anyway. More a case of ball hitting bat there!
another slower ball - even slower this time - and Broad inside edges a drive into his boot
great yorker! Broad digs it out to mid-on and they scamper through
nicely played by Anderson, glancing out to deep square leg for two runs
huge swipe across the line from Broad, and Gul has made a mess of his stumps! Gul seals the game with his fourth wicket
